info.title: Seismic Library
info.description: The Seismic Library connector includes actions related to adding, updating, deleting, publishing, and downloading Library content.

post.description: Adds a new file using a multipart/form-data POST containing the file's metadata and the file contents.

parameters.name: resolveNameCollision
parameters.description: Optional query parameter. Accepts true or false, defaults to false.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Json Object with 'name', 'parentFolderId' and 'format' like 'ppt' or 'doc'. Example: {"name" : "Big Presentation", "parentFolderId" : "root", "format": "ppt"}

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Only text file supported here, Add any strings to create file.

patch.description: This endpoint can be use to move a file or update its properties, including system properties such as the name, owner, description, as well as custom properties.

parameters.name: includeResponse
parameters.description: If set it to true, it will return content information otherwise nothing will return.

get.description: Downloads the binary contents of a file.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Optional query parameter. Accepts true or false, defaults to true. If true then response is a 302 redirect to download url,
            else a 200 response with download location in response body.

put.description: Adds a new file version using a multipart/form-data POST containing the file's content in the content form data.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: File content bytes. Use a Content-Disposition that includes a 'filename' parameter to indicate this is file data. The specific filename value is ignored in favor of metadata.name.

get.description: Downloads the binary contents of a file version.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Optional query parameter. Accepts true or false, defaults to true. If true then response is a 302 redirect to download url,
            else a 200 response with download location in response body.

post.description: Copy a file to any target folder.
Adds a new folder inside a given folder. Use the special keywork "root" as the parentFolderId to create a new folder in the teamsite's root

patch.description: This endpoint can be used to move or rename a folder.

put.summary: Create or Get folders by folder path
put.description: Create or Get folders starting from root folder.

post.description: Copy a folder to any target folder.

get.summary: Get the list of items in a folder
get.description:
Get list of items in a folder. Each item's structure closely mirrors the structure returned by the `GET` endpoint for that item type.

 To expand the response there are two optional query string parameters. `includeExpiration` and `includeProperties` can be used to include additional properties within the list response. By default these are set to false.

parameters.name: includeExpiration
parameters.description: If specified and set to 'true', the item's ExpiresAt field will be filled if it has an expiration date.

parameters.name: includeProperties
parameters.description: If specified and set to 'true', the items's Properties field will be filled if it has custom properties.

get.description: This is the generalized endpoint to get information (both built in and custom properties) for any item type.

post.description: Copy any type of item such as a file, folder, url, article, etc... to any target folder.

get.summary: Get all versions for an item
get.description: Gets the list of versions for a given item.
Gets items in the teamsite with the specified External Id or External Connection Id. (Limit 50 items)

put.description: Replace thumbnail on an item. Supported image types include `jpg`, `png`, and `tif`. Thumbnails shall be passed as a base64 encoded string in the body.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Provide base64 encoded string of thumbnail.

get.description: Gets list of instructions on an item.

post.summary: Add an instruction on an item
post.description: Adds an instruction on an item.

delete.summary: Delete an instruction on an item
delete.description: Deletes an instruction on an item.

post.description: This endpoint can be used to immediately promote and publish content, or schedule publish of content for a future date for up to 10 unpublished documents

put.description: This endpoint is to unpublished a document that has been published.
Approve, reject, or revoke a given workflow step. Must be authenticated as the assigned user in order to complete this action.

get.summary: Get information for a particular workflow
get.description: Get information for a particular workflow given by workflow id.
Get list of approval workflows. Use optional query string parameters to filter the response.

post.description: Adds a new URL using an application/json POST with all required information in the POST body.

patch.description: This endpoint allows any of the url's properties to be modified including system properties such as the name, owner, description, as well as custom properties.

post.description: Copy a url to any target folder.

ownerId.description: The userId of the owner of the item.

experts.description: A list of experts for this item. A user expert would be in the form `{"type":"user", "id":"the users id"}`. A group expert would be in the form `{"type":"group", "id":"the group id"}`.

properties.description: An array of properties and their values where each property is identified by its id such as `{"id": "the property id","values": ["Value A", "Value B"]}`. The property name can be included, but will be ignored.

expiresAt.description: This date does not accept the time component, so should be specified as a UTC YYYY-MM-DD.

parentFolderId.description: Use "root" to place items in the root folder of the teamsite.

ownerId.description: The userId of the owner of the item.
